articles.title: Aging farm workforce forces a reckoning: Who will pick America's crops? - NPR
articles.description: U.S. farms have faced worker shortages for years. Now compounding the problem: The children of farmworkers are leaving the fields, forcing farm owners to look to other countries for labor.
articles.content:
Paola Mendoza, the daughter of farmworkers, says her parents didn't want her to join them in the fields. She's now in college, studying to be a teacher.
Mike Kane for NPR
TOPPENISH, Wash. By 6 in t… [+7323 chars]

articles.title: Classroom Ready: Back to school tips for healthy eyes - KPRC 2 Click2Houston
articles.description: Dr. Ronald Benner, President of the American Optometric Association, joins KPRC 2+ at 7 to share back to school tips for healthy eyes.
